Package emissary.config

Class ConfigUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • emissary.config.ConfigUtil
  • public class ConfigUtil
extends Object
    This configuration utility collection helps to find configuration for various classes and objects. It responds to -Demissary.config.dir=value and treats it as a local directory in which to find configuration files. Failing to find a local file, many of these methods will try to retrieve config data from a resource stream (i.e. the classpath). The package name to use can be prefixed with some package of your choosing by setting -Demissary.config.pkg=value.

      • CONFIG_DIR_PROPERTY

        public static final String CONFIG_DIR_PROPERTY
        This property specifies the config override directory. When present, we look here first for config info. If not present, we try and load from the classpath as a resource. The property is set with -D"emissary.config.dir"
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CONFIG_FLAVOR_PROPERTY

        public static final String CONFIG_FLAVOR_PROPERTY
        This property specified the install/config flavor to run. This will opt-import and merge config files special to the desired flavor allowing multiple configurations to be kept in the same configuration package
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • getConfigInfo

        public static Configurator getConfigInfo​(String[] preferences)
                                  throws IOException
        Get configurator by trying the list of preferences in order and using the first one that is found. Sometimes and array signature can be easier to use from a static context.
        Parameters:
        preferences - array of string names to try
        Returns:
        the configurator
        Throws:
        IOException - if none of the prefs can be found

      • addFlavors

        public static String[] addFlavors​(String name)
        Add the current config Flavor to the name of the resource passed in. E.g. emissary.pkg.Foo.cfg => emissary.pkg.Foo-${FLAVOR}.cfg
        Parameters:
        name - the base resource or config name
        Returns:
        the name with the flavor in it

        Parameters:
        f - the named config item (path not necessary, but will be used if present)
        Returns:
        Input Stream, caller must close.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getClassNameInventory

        public static Configurator getClassNameInventory()
                                          throws IOException,
                                                 EmissaryException
        Gets all ClassNameInventory from configured file.

        For a single entry in 'emissary.config.dir' or comma separated list of config directories, every file that starts with 'emissary.admin.ClassNameInventory' will be combined into a Configurator. This means files like 'emissary.admin.ClassNameInventory.cfg', 'emissary.admin.ClassNameInventory-module1.cfg' and 'emissary.admin.ClassNameInventory-whatever.cfg' will be used. The concept of flavoring no longer applies to the ClassNameInventory.

        Returns:
        Configurator with all emissary.admin.ClassNameInventory
        Throws:
        IOException - If there is some I/O problem.
        EmissaryException - If no config files are found.

      • main

        Read a merged config setup and print the results
